text: "Our Last Song Together" is a song co-written and originally recorded by Neil Sedaka. It is a track from his 1973 LP The Tra-La Days Are Over, the third of four single releases from the album. The song became a Top 40 hit in the UK (#31) and Ireland (#19) in late 1973. ==Synopsis== The song is a self- description of the breakup of the songwriting partnership between Sedaka and Howard Greenfield, ending a decades-long collaboration. Greenfield was largely distraught by the breakup; he neverless decided to write "Our Last Song Together" and "Love Will Keep Us Together" as their last songs. from Sedaka's official YouTube channel ==Cover versions== The first cover of "Our Last Song Together" was recorded by Euson in 1973. In 1975, two covers of "Our Last Song Together" charted in the U.S.: Bobby Sherman on the Easy Listening chart and Bo Donaldson and The Heywoods on the Pop chart. Agnetha Fältskog (ABBA) recorded a Swedish cover version in 1973, "Vi har hunnit fram till refrängen" as the B-Side to her solo single, "En sång om sorg och glädje" which reached #1 on the Swedish charts in 1973. Both songs were included on her 1973 album, Agnetha Fältskogs bästa . The song was also covered in 1975 by Pratt & McClain. ==Chart history== ;Neil Sedaka {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1973) !Peak position |- | |- |UK Singles Chart | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |} ;Bo Donaldson & the Heywoods {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1975) !Peak position |- |U.S. Billboard Hot 100Joel Whitburn's Top Pop Singles 1955–1990 - | style="text-align:center;"|95 |- |U.S. Cash Box Top 100Cash Box Top 100 Singles, July 26, 1975 |align="center"|98 |- |} ;Bobby Sherman {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1975) !Peak position |- |U.S. Billboard Easy Listening | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |} ==References== ==External links== *Lyrics of this song * Category:1973 songs Category:1973 singles Category:1975 singles Category:Neil Sedaka songs Category:Songs written by Neil Sedaka Category:Songs with lyrics by Howard Greenfield Category:Bo Donaldson and The Heywoods songs Category:Bobby Sherman songs Category:The Rocket Record Company singles Category:Number-one singles in Sweden Category:Songs about music Category:Metasongs
